prompt:
Explain Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) to me using bullet points. Do not contain any commas in your response. End your response with a postscript indicated by P.P.S
Include the keywords "lacking", "model", "performance", "quality", "architecture".
response:
Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are a type of neural network architecture that lacks a clear model for generating high-quality images. Instead, they rely on a two-player game between a generator and a discriminator to improve the quality of the generated images. The generator tries to create images that are indistinguishable from real images, while the discriminator tries to distinguish between real and generated images. This adversarial process helps to improve the performance and quality of the generated images.
P.P.S. GANs have been used in various applications such as image synthesis, style transfer, and image generation.
